message.content:
cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.CV, cs.NE 

This paper is about cross-lingual word embeddings, which are commonly used in natural language processing (NLP) tasks such as machine translation and transfer learning. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.CL (Computation and Language), which focuses on NLP and related topics. The paper also proposes a new unsupervised method for learning word mappings, which involves maximizing the mean discrepancy between the distribution of transferred embedding and target embedding. This suggests that the paper may also be relevant to sub-categories such as cs.LG (Machine Learning), cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence), and cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing), which deal with various aspects of machine learning and optimization. Finally, the paper includes experimental results that involve visualizing word embeddings, which suggests that it may also be relevant to cs.CV (Computer Vision), which deals with image and video analysis.
